item.title: Siemens Healthineers and Global Fund Partner to Accelerate AI Adoption for Tuberculosis Diagnosis
item.description: Siemens Healthineers and Global Fund Partner to Accelerate AI Adoption for Tuberculosis Diagnosis Introduction Siemens Healthineers, a leading medical technology company, has teamed up with the Global Fund to promote the use of artificial intelligence (AI) in diagnosing tuberculosis (TB). This partnership aims to improve the efficiency of TB screening and diagnosis by integrating AI technology with chest X-rays. By leveraging AI algorithms, routine scans can be read more quickly and accurately, leading to early detection and improved patient outcomes.

item.title: Main
74 lakh WhatsApp accounts banned in India
item.description: WhatsApp took action and banned 7,420,748 accounts in India from August 1 to August 31, in compliance with the new IT Rules of 2021.

item.title: B'luru provided enough content for Noah's shows: Mazumdar-Shaw
item.description: Biocon Chairperson Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw said that Bengaluru has provided enough content for the future shows of Trevor Noah.

item.title: Banker fired for claiming he had 2 sandwiches, 2 coffees by himself sues Citi, loses case
item.description: A former Citibank employee, fired for lying about eating two sandwiches, two pasta dishes and drinking two coffees by himself, has lost a wrongful dismissal case in the UK.

item.title: Choosing a life partner goes to the root of right to life CJI
item.description: The Chief Justice of India DY Chandrachud, while delivering his judgment on same-sex marriage, said that choosing a life partner is an integral part of choosing one's course of life. "Some may regard this as the most important decision of their life. This right goes to the root of the right to life and liberty under Article 21," he added.

item.title: Delhi crowd cheers for Naveen-ul-Haq days after his hug with Virat Kohli, video goes viral
item.description: The crowd at the Arun Jaitley Stadium in Delhi cheered for Afghanistan fast bowler Naveen-ul-Haq during the ODI World Cup 2023 match between Afghanistan and England. A video has gone viral showing Naveen acknowledging the crowd's support while fielding in the deep. This came days after Virat Kohli had embraced Naveen and urged crowd to not mock him.

item.title: Dunzo Co-founder Dalvir Suri quits amid cash crunch
item.description: Dunzo Co-founder Dalvir Suri is leaving the cash-strapped startup after over six years. His departure comes amid Dunzo's cash-flow crisis which forced the company to lay off hundreds of employees in several rounds.

item.title: Govt to form committee to decide the rights & entitlements of persons in queer unions: CJI
item.description: Chief Justice of India DY Chandrachud, while delivering his judgement on same-sex marriage, said that the Centre should form a committee headed by the Cabinet Secretary to look into rights and entitlements of persons in queer unions.

item.title: Hamas releases footage of 21-yr-old woman kidnapped by them
item.description: Hamas has released a video showing a statement from a 21-year-old woman who was kidnapped by the militant group from Israel on October 7. The woman identified as Mia Schem could be seen getting treatment for her injured arm. She also asked to be returned to her family as quickly as possible.

item.title: Homosexuality isn't urban concept or limited to upper classes of society: CJI
item.description: Chief Justice of India DY Chandrachud stated that homosexuality or queerness is not limited to urban areas or the upper classes of society.

item.title: House from 'Sex Education' goes on sale, pics released
item.description: The iconic house from Netflix show 'Sex Education' has been listed for sale for £1.5 million (over ₹15 crore). Located in England's Herefordshire, the five-bedroom chalet was built in 1912 as a salmon fishing lodge and is of Norwegian design. It has a custom-painted wood kitchen, a conservatory, a stone pizza oven, a summer house, and a Swedish hot bath.

item.title: I have lost my bronze medal to a transgender woman, help me: India's Swapna on Nandini
item.description: Indian heptathlete Swapna Barman speaks out against Nandini Agasara after losing bronze medal in women's heptathlon at 19th Asian Games

item.title: Incorrect to say marriage is static and unchanging institution: CJI
item.description: CJI DY Chandrachud stated that it is incorrect to say that marriage is a static and unchanging institution while delivering judgement on same-sex marriage. He also mentioned that if the Special Marriage Act is struck down, it will take the country to the pre-Independence era.

item.title: Most wanted terrorist Shahnawaz arrested in Delhi in ISIS case
item.description: Delhi Police Special Cell arrested NIA's most wanted terrorist Shahnawaz alias Shafi Uzzama. NIA had placed a reward of ₹3 lakh on the arrested terrorist Shahnawaz, who is wanted in the Pune ISIS case.

item.title: Nandini left Asian Games village after my complaint, who got her the tickets? asks Swapna
item.description: Swapna Barman, who finished fourth in the Asian Games, claimed that Nandini Agasara left the Asian Games village after her complaint. Swapna questioned who got Nandini the tickets to leave the village.

item.title: New Ring Road to Delhi airport will reduce travel time to 20 mins: Gadkari
item.description: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari announced that the Urban Extension Road-II, a key ring road project in Delhi, will open to commuters within the next two-three months. The Ring Road will reduce travel time to Delhi Airport from two hours to 20 minutes.

item.title: Pakistan cricketers go out for dinner in Hyderabad, click selfies with fans; video surfaces
item.description: Members of Pakistan's ODI World Cup 2023 squad were spotted enjoying dinner at 'Jewel of Nizam' restaurant in Hyderabad. Watch the video as players click selfies with fans and enjoy the hospitality.

item.title: Punjab smash highest-ever total in T20 cricket history by an Indian side
item.description: Punjab on Tuesday created history by smashing the highest-ever total in T20 cricket by an Indian side. Punjab put up a total of 275/6 against Andhra in their Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy 2023 match to set the record.

item.title: Ravichandran Ashwin's 'duplicate' declines Australia's offer to assist them
item.description: Mahesh Pithiya, dubbed as Ravichandran Ashwin's duplicate, has declined Australia's offer to assist them in their preparations for the ODI World Cup 2023.

item.title: Russian President Putin arrives in China to meet Xi Jinping
item.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin arrived in China on Tuesday to meet President Xi Jinping in a rare trip abroad. Putin would hold talks with Xi on the sidelines of a forum marking 10 years of China's Belt and Road Initiative (BRI).

item.title: Shahid Afridi's sister passes away
item.description: Shahid Afridi's sister has passed away, the former Pakistan captain said in a tweet. With heavy hearts we inform you that our beloved sister passed away.

item.title: Supreme Court refuses to legalise same-sex marriages
item.description: A Constitution bench of the Supreme Court on Tuesday refused to give legal recognition to same-sex marriages.

item.title: Sutirtha Mukherjee, Ayhika Mukherjee win India's 1st ever bronze in women's doubles TT at Asiad
item.description: Indian table tennis players Sutirtha Mukherjee and Ayhika Mukherjee on Monday won India's first-ever bronze medal in women's doubles table tennis event in the history of Asian Games.

item.title: Sutirtha Mukherjee, Ayhika Mukherjee win India's 1st ever bronze in women's doubles TT at Asiad
item.description: Indian table tennis players Sutirtha Mukherjee and Ayhika Mukherjee on Monday won India's first-ever bronze medal in women's doubles table tennis event in the history of Asian Games.

item.title: Top US govt official praises Jaishankar, calls him 'architect' of modern US-India ties
item.description: A top official of Joe Biden's administration in the US has praised External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar, calling him 'incredibly talented' and an 'architect' of modern ties between the two nations.

item.title: Trudeau trying to crush free speech in Canada: Elon Musk
item.description: Elon Musk accuses Canadian PM Justin Trudeau of attempting to suppress free speech in Canada

item.title: Udhayanidhi files counter affidavit in HC over 'Sanatana' remark
item.description: DMK's Udhayanidhi Stalin challenges petition filed against him by Hindu Munnani office bearers over his controversial remarks on Sanatana Dharma

item.title: Unmarried couples, including queer couples, can jointly adopt a child: CJI Chandrachud
item.description: During the verdict on same-sex marriage, Chief Justice of India (CJI) DY Chandrachud said that unmarried couples, including queer couples, can jointly adopt a child. CJI Chandrachud also stated that the Central Adoption Resource Authority circular not giving adoption rights to queer couples is violative of Article 15 of the Constitution.

item.title: Vikram lander happily sleeping on Moon, it did its job well: ISRO
item.description: ISRO chief S Somanath said Chandrayaan-3's Vikram lander is 'happily sleeping' on Moon. 'It [did] its job very well...If it wishes to wake up, let it wake up. Until then, we'll wait,' he added.

item.title: Vithya becomes joint-fastest Indian woman to run 400m hurdles, equals PT Usha's record
item.description: Hurdler Vithya Ramraj has become the joint-fastest Indian woman to run 400m hurdles, equaling PT Usha's record. Read more to know about her achievement.

item.title: Vote against Anant, he has limited experience: Advisory firm on RIL board appointment
item.description: Proxy advisory firm Institutional Shareholder Services advised shareholders to vote against the proposal to appoint Mukesh Ambani's youngest son Anant on the board of Reliance Industries. Anant's limited leadership/board experience of around 6 years, raises concerns on his potential contribution to the board.

item.title: Woman passenger delays flight by 5 hrs after saying 'Do I have bomb' at Varanasi airport
item.description: An Akasa Air flight from Varanasi to Mumbai was delayed by five hours after a woman passenger's remark triggered a security scare. The woman, apparently annoyed by strict pre-boarding checks at the airport, said, 'Mere paas bomb hai kya (Do I have a bomb).' Following her remark, all passengers were deplaned and their bags were checked again thoroughly.
